descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases experienced contributors by promoting newly competent members.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by recognizing and advancing capable members.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by elevating proven, experienced contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development through direct mentorship and collaboration.
Implicit knowledge transfer increases promotion rates by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More core developers increase the capacity for mentorship and implicit knowledge sharing.
Explicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development by providing accessible documentation and guides.
An increase in the colored stock (e.g., potential contributors) provides more candidates to become new contributors.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential flow of individuals developing their skills.
A larger core developer group can lead to higher absolute turnover as more individuals are at risk of leaving.
A larger pool of experienced contributors provides more candidates eligible for promotion to core developer.
